sentences.en: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.cn: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.en: an attempt to slow down the rate of economic growth
sentences.cn: 放慢经济增速的努力

sentences.en: at this rate, I won't have a job to go back to.
sentences.cn: 这样的话，我就没有工作可干了。

sentences.en: Callers are charged a premium rate of 48p a minute.
sentences.cn: 打电话要支付每分钟48便士的附加费。

sentences.en: Calls cost 36p (cheap rate) and 48p (peak rate) per minute.
sentences.cn: 电话每分钟36便士（优惠费率）和48便士（高峰费率）。

sentences.en: Children learn at different rates.
sentences.cn: 小孩学东西有快有慢。

sentences.en: Experimenters have succeeded in controlling the rate and regularity of the heartbeat.
sentences.cn: 实验者已经成功控制了心跳的速度和频率。

sentences.en: I never rated him.
sentences.cn: 我从来都不认为他好。

sentences.en: Immediately his heart rate (= the number of beats per minute ) increased.
sentences.cn: 他的心率立即加快了。

sentences.en: In those crowded streets her attire did not rate a second glance.
sentences.cn: 在那些拥挤的街道她的穿着并未引起注意。

sentences.en: Most people's pulse rate is more than 70 beats per minute.
sentences.cn: 大多数人的脉率都在每分钟70次以上.

sentences.en: New diet books appear at a rate of nearly one a week.
sentences.cn: 新的饮食类书籍差不多一周出一本。

sentences.en: Nurses are demanding higher rates of pay.
sentences.cn: 护士在要求提高工资。

sentences.en: Once the rate rises it never drops back to its previous level.
sentences.cn: 一旦价格上去了就再也不会降到以前的水平了。

sentences.en: The bank lifted its basic home loans rate to 10.99% from 10.75%.
sentences.cn: 银行将基本房屋贷款利率从10.75%提高到10.99%。

sentences.en: The big clubs are becoming increasingly impatient at the rate of progress.
sentences.cn: 大牌俱乐部对缓慢的进展越来越不耐烦了。

sentences.en: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good ) .
sentences.cn: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

sentences.en: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.cn: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

sentences.en: The detection rate for racial crimes is appallingly low.
sentences.cn: 种族罪案的侦破率之低让人震惊。

sentences.en: The nation's unemployment rate has been climbing steadily since last June.
sentences.cn: 自去年6月以来，该国的失业率一直在不断上升。

sentences.en: The rate at which hair grows can be agonisingly slow.
sentences.cn: 头发生长的速度可能极其缓慢。

sentences.en: The rate of disconnections following non-payment of water charges is rising.
sentences.cn: 不缴水费引起的断水的比率正在上升。

sentences.en: The rate of inflation is running at about 2.7 percent.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀率大约为2.7%。

sentences.en: Well, at any rate, let me thank you for all you did.
sentences.cn: 好吧，不管怎样，还是要感谢你所做的一切。

words.tran_cn: 可估价的；按比例的；可评价的；应课税的
按比例的；可估价的；应纳税的（等于ratable）
等级；等级评定；额定功率

phrases.tran_cn: 照这（或那）种情形，既然如此（或那样）
应变速率；应变率；变形速度

trans.tran_cn: 速度，进度，比率，价格，费用，房产税
trans.tran_en: the number of times something happens, or the number of examples of something within a certain period

trans.tran_cn: 评估，评价，看好，划分等级，配得上
trans.tran_en: if you rate someone or something, you think they are very good

trans.tran_cn: 被评价， 被列入特定级别
trans.tran_en: to be considered as having a particular quality, value, or standard

trans.tran_cn: 对…估价，评估；给…定级，把…列为；值得，应得
